channel.title: Absolute AppSec
channel.itunes:author: Ken Johnson and Seth Law
channel.description: A weekly podcast of all things application security related. Hosted by Ken Johnson and Seth Law.

item.title: Episode 1: Introductions
item.description: Introductions with Seth and Ken

item.title: Episode 2: Current Events
item.description: Weekly discussion

item.title: Episode 3: Jerry Gamblin
item.description: Featuring Guest Jerry Gamblin

item.title: Episode 4: Evan Johnson
item.description: Featuring Guest Evan Johnson

item.title: Episode 5: Stefan Edwards and Dave Coursey
item.description: Featuring Guests Stefan Edwards and David Coursey

item.title: Episode 6: Kevin Cody
item.description: Featuring Guest Kevin Cody

item.title: Episode 7: Current Events
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss current events

item.title: Episode 8: Neil Matatall
item.description: Featuring Guest Neil Matatal

item.title: Episode 9: Jason Haddix
item.description: Seth and Ken talk with Jason Haddix about bug bounties

item.title: Episode 10: Jimmy Mesta
item.description: Jimmy Mesta joins Seth and Ken to talk about Kubernetes and Container security.

item.title: Episode 11: David Coursy and Stefan Edwards
item.description: David Coursey and Stefan Edwards reprise their discussion with Ken and Seth

item.title: Episode 12: Justin Collins
item.description: Ken and Justin Collins join from LocoMocoSec to discuss static analyzers

item.title: Episode 13: Charles Nwatu
item.description: Charles Nwatu joins Ken and Seth

item.title: Episode 14: Karthik Gaekwad
item.description: Karthik Gaekwad joins Ken and Seth

item.title: Episode 15: Kevin Cody
item.description: Kevin Cody joins Ken and Seth to talk about mobile security testing

item.title: Episode 16: Hipster Languages
item.description: Ken and Seth talk about hipster languages and frameworks

item.title: Episode 17: Efail and CSRF
item.description: Ken and Seth talk about current news (Efail) and CSRF Tokens

item.title: Episode 18: Chris Gates
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Chris Gates to talk about Purple Teaming and the WeirdAAL tool

item.title: Episode 19: CFPs and More
item.description: Ken and Seth talk about current events, submitting CFPs, and more

item.title: Episode 20: Authentication and JWTs
item.description: Ken and Seth talk more about authentication, JWTs and everything that is wrong with both of them.

item.title: Episode 21: Alex Smolen
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Alex Smolen (@alsmola) to talk about current events, cloudtrail audit, and webauthn.

item.title: Episode 22: Jimmy Mesta
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Jimmy Mesta (@jimmesta) to talk about Kubernetes and container security.

item.title: Episode 23: Ken Toler
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Ken Toler (@relotnek) and talk security champions and security program management.

item.title: Episode 24: Jason White
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Jason White (@misfir3) and talk about transitioning from a developer to an application security professional.

item.title: Episode 25: Scott Piper
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Scott Piper (@0xdabbad00) and talk AWS Security, including https://flaws.cloud, cloud mapper, and cloud tracker projects.

item.title: Episode 26: Justin Larson
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Justin Larson (@Phant0mTrav3ler) and talk about building an AppSec program from scratch.

item.title: Episode 27: Jim Manico
item.description: Ken and Seth are joined by Jim Manico (@manicode) RAW, training, OWASP, code security, and all things AppSec.

item.title: Episode 28: Astha Singhal
item.description: Astha Singhal (@astha_singhal) joins Ken and Seth to talk automating application security and bug bounties.

item.title: Episode 29: Matt Tesauro
item.description: Matt Tesauro (@matt_tesauro) talks OWASP, community involvement, Defect Dojo, and the AppSec Pipeline toolbox with Ken and Seth.

item.title: Episode 30: Dave Ferguson
item.description: Dave Ferguson (@_sc0rn) talks about the futility of developer training, initial discovery of CSRF in on netflix.com, and application scanning with Ken and Seth.

item.title: Episode 31: Rob Fuller
item.description: Practical advice on submitting and writing effective findings for bug bounties and reports. Rob Fuller (@mubix) talks about his path into security, CCDC, volunteerism, NoVA Hackers and more.

item.title: Episode 32: Eric Johnson
item.description: Setup tips for starting an assessment with Burp Suite Professional. Eric Johnson (@emjohn20) talks with Ken and Seth about Roslyn, building Puma Scan, SANS, and more.

item.title: Episode 33: John Melton
item.description: Seth and Ken go over fully vetting functions during code reviews. John Melton (@_jtmelton) talks with Ken and Seth about static analysis tools, building an appsec program, open source, and more.

item.title: Episode 34: Stefan Edwards
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined last minute by Stefan Edwards (@lojikil) to talk about security unit tests, fuzzing, and all things you will need to google later on. Blockchains and secure contracts are introduced and somewhat explained.

item.title: Episode 35: Travis McPeak
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss server side request forgery and then pick Travis McPeak's (@travismcpeak) brain about AWS security, his path into security, QA testing, and Netflix cloud security tools.

item.title: Episode 36: Mike McCabe
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss cross-site scripting and input validation/output encoding findings. Later joined by Mike McCabe's (@mccabe615) talking about cloud security, building an appsec program, interviews (both for and against) and CHRISTMAS.

item.title: Episode 37: Stefan Edwards
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss security gifts for appsec peeps. Joined by Stefan Edwards (@lojikil) to talk about his origin story (Seth gets bagged on), formal verification, and a multitude of other topics.

item.title: Episode 38: Matt Konda
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss node packages and event_stream fallout. Matt Konda (@mkonda) joins to talk about OWASP, the Glue tool, Jemurai and his origin story and other topics.

item.title: Episode 39: Jerry Gamblin
item.description: Is there such a thing as breach fatigue? When have we had enough? Seth and Ken are joined by Jerry Gamblin of Kenna Security to discuss recent breaches and AWS Re:Invent.

item.title: Episode 40: Code Reviews
item.description: Seth and Ken talk through secure code reviews and assessment scoping, more on breaches, the Google congressional hearings and more.

item.title: Episode 41: Hidden File/Dir Enumeration and Will Bengtson
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss hidden file and directory enumeration. Joined by Will Bengtson to talk AWS and cloud security, including cloudtrail and trailblazer.

item.title: Episode 42: SSRF Rebinding and Segment Team (Leif Dreizler and David Scrobonia)
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss SSRF Rebinding defenses with Segment (Leif, David, and Achille). Additional topics include password complexity, password resets, and using Troy Hunt's breach database.

item.title: Episode 43: DerbyCon, pwnhead, and Keith Hoodlet
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Keith Hoodlet (@andMyHacks) to discuss DerbyCon, pwnhead, and application security in medical devices.

item.title: Episode 44: AppSec California, running a Bug Bounty program, and David Coursey
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined once again by David Coursey (@dacoursey) to review topics from AppSec California 2019, including building developer relationships and the OWASP ZAP HUD. Ken and Dave answer questions about the time investment required to support a Bug Bounty program. David discusses his role at Allstate.

item.title: Episode 45: Making the most of Bug Bounties, managing an AppSec program, and Sean Poris
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Sean Poris (@skp00) of Verizon Media to talk about making the most of a bug bounty program, Sean's path into application security from his budding time as a biologist, and strategies on managing a large application security program. Sean also talks about methods he has used for finding and developing application security engineers.

item.title: Episode 46: Fuzzing, Frameworks, Training and Daniel Miessler
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about the recent release of ClusterFuzz by Google. Joined by Daniel Miessler (@Daniel Miessler) to talk about the SecLists project, how it relates to fuzzing, training developers and his path into security.

item.title: Episode 47: Mapping Application Source Code, Mobile OWASP Top 10, Mobile Application Testing, and Kevin Cody
item.description: Seth and Ken review steps taken during a secure code review to map out an application. Joined by Kevin Cody (@kevcody) to talk mobile application testing, OWASP Mobile Top 10, what devices to use when performing these tests and how python is awesome.

item.title: Episode 48: .dev domains, Kubernetes Secrets, Threat Modeling as Code, OWASP Glue Project and Omer Levi Hevroni
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss recent events with the .dev domain and why developers should care. Omer Levi Hevroni (@omerlh) stops by to talk about the OWASP Glue Project, the Kamus project for managing Kubernetes secrets, and Threat Modeling as code. Also .Net.

item.title: Episode 49: Subdomain Takeovers, DNS SSRF, Oauth Best Practices, Top 10 Web Hacking Techniques of 2019
item.description: Seth and Ken talk through subdomain takeovers vulnerabilities at large companies and identification of DNS SSRF. Ken walks through a few oauth best practices. A look at the Portswigger list of Top 10 Web Hacking Techniques of 2018.

item.title: Episode 50: Static Analysis Tools, DevSecOps, Secure Code Training with Eric Heitzman
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about number 8 in the top web hacking techniques of 2018. Discussions on static analysis tools and approach to usidng them. Eric Heitzman joins to talk about his background, DevSecOps, secure code training and more.

item.title: Episode 51: XXE review and techniques, Assessment Reporting and Process with Jessica Ryan
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about new techniques for exploiting XXE, number 7 in the top web hacking techniques of 2018. Discussions on assessment process, including reporting, note taking and soft skills with Jessica Ryan.

item.title: Episode 52: Serialization Vulns, Managing Careers, and Hacking your Happiness with Chris Gates
item.description: Seth and Ken talk about serialization vulnerabilities, number 6 in the top web hacking techniques of 2018. Discussions on continuous integration, hacking jenkins, reading code to find vulns, maintaining your edge, career growth, and hacking your happiness with Chris Gates.

item.title: Episode 53: Building AppSec at Github with Greg Ose
item.description: Seth and Ken talk AppCache vulnerabilities and postMessage exploits from PortSwigger's Top 10 web hacking techniques of 2018. Greg Ose joins them to talk about building application security programs, developer involvement, his background, and product security at Github.

item.title: Episode 54: Recon-NG and Burp Suite v2 with Tim Tomes
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Tim Tomes, aka LaNMaSteR53. We discuss Tim's path into application security, his work on Recon-NG, and his analysis of Burp Suite Professional's version 2.

item.title: Episode 55: Stefan Edwards ruins Infosec - Testing Edition
item.description: Seth is joined once again by Stefan Edwards. First in the series "Lojikil ruins Infosec". Ken is at LocomocoSec in Hawaii, so Seth and Stefan (@lojikil) talk all things testing, including symbolic execution, fuzzing, and why everything is awful. Seth becomes a nihilist.

item.title: Episode 56: Learn to Code / Loco Moco Sec Recap
item.description: Seth and Ken get back together to talk about Loco Moco Sec and recent industry news. Specifically, should all security people be able to code? Is it a strict requirement? Ken gives his take on the talks from LocomocoSec and why we should all be there in 2020.

item.title: Episode 57: OWASP WIA (Women in AppSec) Committee
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by the OWASP WIA (Women in AppSec, @owaspwia) Committee. We discuss diversity in security and how the committee and OWASP is making the community more inclusive. Topics include first security conferences, how to get involved, and more.

item.title: Episode 58: David Lindner on RASP, Mobile, IoT
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss Edge Side Include Injection. Subsequently joined by David Lindner (@golfhackerdave), the current head of AppSec at Contrast Security. David talks all about RASP, mobile and IoT security plus talk a little bit about appsec program building.

item.title: Episode 59: James Wickett on DevOps
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss Minecraft mod hacking and applying AppSec tools to the practice. Joined by James Wickett (@wickett) to talk about the history of DevOps, why software security people should learn to code, and current trends in the DevOps space.

item.title: Episode 60: Stefan Edwards, Huawei, Android Security, and Programming Languages
item.description: Seth is joined once again by Stefan Edwards to talk about current events and ruin another portion of information security. Topics include Huawei, Android Security, and Programming Languages.

item.title: Episode 61: Tanja Janca, DevSlop, Diversity, and Inclusion
item.description: Based on demand, Seth and Ken are joined by Tanya Janca (@shehackspurple) to talk about all things OWASP, travel, and experinces. Topics include OWASP DevSlop, diversity, and inclusion

item.title: Episode 62: Abdullah Munawar, Ben Pick, Global AppSec DC, and Running an OWASP Chapter
item.description: Seth and Ken welcome Abdullah Munawar and Ben Pick to the show. They discuss their path into application security, current roles, and OWASP involvement. Specifically, Abdullah and Ben talk about running the OWASP NoVA chapter and challenges in organizing the Global AppSec DC conference.

item.title: Episode 63: Julian Berton, AppSec Day, Developer Training, and Security Standards
item.description: Julian Berton joins Seth and Ken to talk about Developer Training, Security Standards and AppSec Day, a global Application Security conference in Melbourne, Australia. They also discuss the latest lodash vulnerability and Boeing's outsourcing of developers.

item.title: Episode 64: Hijacked Gems, Zoom RCE, and Marriott Fines
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss conference proposals submissions and how to stand out. Also discussions on the latest security news, including the Zoom vulnerability disclosure, European fines for Marriott, and the latest hijacked/backdoored third-party library.

item.title: Episode 65: Adam Baldwin, 3rd Party Dependencies, and Supply Chain Security
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Adam Baldwin (@adam_baldwin) to discuss a topic we've been talking a lot about - 3rd party dependency and supply chain security. Adam gave a talk at this year's LocoMoco Security conference where he discuss fascinating and VERY relevant topics such as "developer burnout as an attack vector" as well as providing stats such as 97% of modern node applications rely on the code of 3rd party libraries.

item.title: Episode 66: Capital One Breach, NPM, and Secure Code Reviews
item.description: Seth and Ken discuss the latest news, including the Capital One Breach, Project Zero's recent iOS vusnerability disclosures, and further malicious NPM package takeovers. Further topics include learning who to trust and security code reviews.

item.title: Episode 67: Kubernetes Security with Stefan and Bobby
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Stefan (@lojikil) and Bobby (@b0bbytabl3s) to talk about Kubernetes Security based on the assessment they conducted at Trail of Bits.

item.title: Episode 68: Jerry Gamblin, DEF CON 27 Recap
item.description: Jerry Gamblin (@jgamblin) joins Seth and Ken to talk about #hackersummercamp, DEF CON 27, and all things Vegas. Discussion includes NULL license plates, software bill of materials, and more.

item.title: Episode 69: Eric Ellett, Development vs. Security
item.description: Seth and Ken are joined by Eric Ellett (@EricEllett) to talk about software supply chain security. Development vs. Security and how to develop a good relationship with development instead of an antagonistic one.

item.title: Episode 70: Andrew Wilson, OWASP and Training New AppSec Resources
item.description: Andrew Wilson (@azwilsong) , a friend and partner at Bishop Fox joins Seth and Ken to discuss OWASP, running a consultancy, organizing CactusCon, and training new AppSec resources.

item.title: Episode 71: Evan Johnson, Cloudflare and Lastpass
item.description: Eric Johnson (@ejcx_), one of the first podcast guests to join Seth and Ken revisits to talk about recent industry revelations, including the Lastpass vulnerability from Google's Project Zero. Further discussions on Cloudflare Access and ranging topics including Coke's 80s lawsuit involving trade secrets.

item.title: Episode 72: Consulting Horror Stories
item.description: Seth and Ken kickoff October with a discussion of consulting horror stories, both from personal experiences and listener-provided. Additional discussions around Cloudflare's WARP.
